titleStmt.title: The babe of glory, breaking forth in the broken flesh of the saints breathing out the life of God (hid in their flesh) now to be revealed and raised, Isa. 40. 5, 6. By William Erbery.
titleStmt.author: Erbery, William, 1604-1654.

titleStmt.title: The babe of glory, breaking forth in the broken flesh of the saints breathing out the life of God (hid in their flesh) now to be revealed and raised, Isa. 40. 5, 6. By William Erbery.
titleStmt.author: Erbery, William, 1604-1654.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for Giles Calvet [sic], at the signe of the Black spread-Eagle, at the West end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: 'The north star' has separate dated title page; pagination is separate, register is continuous.
The north star = Thomason E.718[8]; The woman preacher = Thomason E.718[9].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
'The woman preacher: or, the man of war.' begins on p. 77 with a caption title.
